text: I don't have one. At school I have lots of responsibilities therefore setting up a new business would be rather overwhelming. Also setting it up outside of school, I wouldn't even know how. I want to open up a business when I get older but than I would have money and  hopefully contact with people that could help me with that. Therefore working somewhere would be much more useful right now. Besides to set up a business I first need to learn how it works in a bigger companies so than I will have some idea on how I will want to run my business successfully
I think that all sounds sensible
I didn't necessarily mean start a big or hugely serious business mow but more so learn and gave some fun doing little projects like the one you previously mentioned you did at school
If you have lots of studies and activities already taking up your time at the moment then that's what you should focus on I agree
Let's focus on helping you get a weekend job for now :grin:
Also if there's anything in your school and study life you have questions on and think I might be able to give some advice on please don't hesitate to ask and I'll see what I can help with
I studied Business and Economics at A Level if that's useful at all
